chargeHist.descr: Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime
Use a Computer to Facilitate a Child Sex Crime

result.execSummary:
The defendant Ross W Krueger was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Child Enticement-Sexual Contact, a class D felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.07(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

superMiscConds.notes: Conditions of extended supervision the same as probation if revoked.

miscConds.notes: Outstanding financial obligations are not a condition of probation & are to be paid directly to the Shawano Co Clerk of Court office within 30 days.  Debts older than 60 days will be processed for tax intercept & civil judgments.  All available enforcement actions will be used to collect the debt.  Payment plans available for qualifying amounts.
Huber / work release granted for any purpose the Law allows.

Submit DNA sample.
Register as a sex offender and comply with registry.
No unsupervised contact with anyone <18 without Agent approval.
Counseling as recommended by Agent.
Internet use as defined by Agent.
Full time employment (32 hrs/wk) or 5 job searches/week.

timeConds.notes:
4 days sentence credit.
Can serve in another county if actual incarceration.

judgments.action: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

charges.dispoDesc: Guilty Due to No Contest Plea

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.
Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt: PSI completed.  Defendant's age is 33 not 32 as listed.  Letters of support submitted by Attny Brabazon.  DA requesting a Withheld Sentence, 5 years probation with 1 year county jail and other conditions as noted in PSI.  Arguments by both attorneys.  Defendant makes a statement.  Voting and firearms restrictions noted.  Court makes a statement and sentences defendant to 4 year (3 confinement + 1 extended supervision) imposed & stayed, 5 years probation with conditions.
Character letters from Barbara H., Kerry M., Jessica N-B, Mitchell K.

no unsupervised contact with anyone under 18, no travel outside WI, do not use any device that connects to Internet
No possession of devices that can access the internet.  No contact with anyone under the age of 18.  No travel outside the state without prior court approval.
Defendant Ross W Krueger appeared by video means. Prosecuting Atty Catharine Denise White appeared for State of Wisconsin.  Adjourned initial appearance scheduled for February 23, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
